Introduction (100 words)
The Chernobyl nuclear disaster that occurred in 1986 was an unprecedented catastrophe that gripped not only Ukraine but also had far-reaching consequences on the environment, human health, and the political and socioeconomic landscape of the Soviet Union and neighboring countries.
